results.title: Illness in old age
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
The Geriatric Unit of the Cowley Road Hospital, Oxford, emphasise cure rather than just keeping the elderly in an institution. Includes a day hospital for the convalescent. Doctor Lionel Cosin, a pioneer in this field, explains how the hospital carries out its work.

results.title: Illegal abortion
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: A dramatization that illustrates the situation of a young couple, particularly of the young woman, faced with an unwanted pregnancy and desiring an abortion forbidden by law. The film portrays her dilemma from the time the pregnancy is confirmed by her doctor to the harrowing moments in a back room where it is terminated by an illegal practitioner. Photographed by Robert Nichol. Edited by Roy Ayton Sound by Victor Merrill. Cast includes: Sabina Fircks, Frank Heron, Elaine Ives Cameron, Ken James, Bill Lynn, Walter Massey, Vladimir Rajewsky, David Schurmann

results.brief_description: The people of Papua New Guinea learn about the British electoral system in their first independent election, with all of its attendant contradictions.

results.title: Il Trovatore by Giuseppe Verdi
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, Australian Opera and Riccardo Pellizzeri
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian and with English sub-titles, this performance was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, July 2, 1983 and is part of the popular ‘Esso night at the opera’. Performers include: Cynthia Johnston, Joan Sutherland, Jonathan Summers, Kenneth Collins. The Australian Opera (Sydney) conducted by Richard Bonynge. Staged by Elijah Moshinsky. Features the Australian Opera Chorus and Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra.

results.title: Il Trovatore
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Patroni Griffi, National Video Corporation, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This production of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Il Trovatore” with Libretto by Salvatore Cammarano, in four acts, was performed at the magnificent outdoor theatre, the Arena di Verona in 1985. Set in the environs of Zaragoza, the capital of the Kingdom of Aragon, and in the mountains of Biscay, around 1412, the story consists of three intertwining sub-plots - war, love and revenge. Dramatic and stirring “Il Trovatore” features an excellent lead cast in singers Giorgio Zancanaro (Count Di Luna), Rosalind Plowright (Leonora), Fiorenza Cossotto (Azucena) and Franco Bonisolli (Manrico) supported by the Orchestra and Chorus of the Arena di Verona, chorus master Tullio Boni, conductor Reynald Giovaninetti. A Verdi masterpiece. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Giuseppe Patroni Griffi, National Video Corporation, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Brian Large

results.title: Il Trittico
results.creator_credit: Sylvano Bussotti, National Video Corporation, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Giacomo Puccini’s “Il Trittico” was recorded live in 1983 at the Teatro alla Scalla, Milan, and featured the Chorus and Orchestra of La Scala, Milan with chorus master Romano Gandolfi and conductor Gianandrea Gavazzeni. “Il Trittico” consists of three one act operas each contrasting in its mood and style and yet all three combining to make an interesting and entertaining program. “Il Tabarro” - music by Puccini, libretto by Giuseppe Adami. A tragic domestic drama of clandestine love, desire and death set in Paris and featuring singers Piero Cappuccilli (Michele, a bargeman), Sylvia Sass (Michele’s wife, Giorgetta) and Nicola Martinucci (Luigi, a penniless stevedore and Giorgetta’s lover). “Suor Angelica” - music by Puccini, libretto by Giovacchino Forzano. A sad and gentle tale of a noble, but disgraced, princess who sought solace in becoming a nun. Set in a convent in the latter part of the 17th century and featuring singers Rosalind Plowright (Sister Angelica, the disgraced princess), Dunja Vejzovich (the Princess and aunt to Sister Angelica) and Maria Grazia Allegri (the Abbess). “Gianni Schicchi” - music by Puccini, libretto by Giovacchino Forzano. A witty and humorous tale of family, greed and deception set in 13th century Florence and featuring singers Juan Pons (Gianni Schicchi), Cecilia Gasdia (Lauretta, Schicci’s daughter), Yuri Marusin (Rinuccio, Lauretta’s lover) and Eleonora Jankovic (Zita, Rinuccio’s aunt). Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. Contains guidebook with English translations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sylvano Bussotti, National Video Corporation, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Brian Large

results.title: Il re pastore
results.creator_credit: John Cox, Cami Video ORF ZDF Production and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart’s “Il re Pastore” is presented by the International Mozarteum Foundation Salzburg in association with the Landestheater Salzburg for the 1989 Mozart Week. It tells the story of Alessandro (Alexander the Great) who has freed the city of Sidon from the tyranny of Strato and decides to restore the throne to the legitimate heir. Alessandro discovers that the heir is Aminta, a shepherd. Sung in Italian. Contains Libretto by Pietro Metastasio. Performers include: Angela Maria Blasi, Sylvia McNair, Iris Vermillion, Jerry Hadley, Claes H. Ahnsjo. Academy of St Martin in the Fields (London) conducted by Sir Neville Marriner. Staged by John Cox.

results.title: Il Fantasista
results.brief_description: Three steps every football player should know if they want to be il fantasista - skills, flamboyance and wealth and of course the no. 10. An amusing musical take on football heroes.

results.title: Il Etait Une Fois le Cap Horn = One Upon a Time Cape Horn
results.brief_description: This corporate documentary follows French yachtsman Alain Colas, from the launch of his boat in St Malo to his successful completion of a solo round-the-world journey via Cape Horn.
